title: B-BossMan
author: B-BossMan
content: It's very interesting seeing the movement of this Vega Hub project construction coming to completion. I read that the site will provide 205 megawatts of power supply, although it's also a good and massive development for the Texas state in time of crypto, and there will be more opportunities for management to host miners to increase the Hub8 energy capacity and also a massive boost to the Bitcoin network because there will be an increase in the decentralization of the network and high security also; however, it's good seeing Bitcoin winning.What's your thoughts about this Vega Hub mining project?https://news.bitcoin.com/bitcoin-miner-hut-8-secures-205-mw-power-agreement-in-texas/

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.created_time: March 16, 2025, 11:48:49 PMLast edit: March 18, 2025, 03:26:09 AM by NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: I see many of the replies have no idea about the relationship between mining and the Texas power grid which is ran by ERCOT...If you look in top left of that picture, what do you see? Wind turbines. The mine is literally built right next to a wind farm. Texas is awash with solar and wind power generation. So much for the renewables concerns.As to stability of the mines power: ERCOT is using money from the mining operations to fund their expansion of renewable power and have agreements in place with the all of the mines to act as massive switchable base loads to soak up excess power being generated in their areas. Remember, with solar and wind it is use it or lose it plus at certain times/conditions there in no guarantee as to how much of it there is.When solar and wind cannot provide enough power for the rest of the state the mines are paid a stipend to shut down so power can be sent elsewhere. Win-win for all parties concerned. ERCOT gets to build a huge 'reserve power buffer' for when conditions need it because they have good customers who will buy any excess power and the mines get cheap power when there is the usual expected excess generation capacity from clear skies and good winds. That is why so many massive farms are being built there.At least this latest one looks to be using liquid cooling so local temperatures are not an issue + no more noise complaints.
